tasks.task: Take a deep breath and proceed task by task using the information provided in your system_prompt and this prompt.
Carefully examine the given page for metadata elements as defined in the XML tags in the system prompt.
Pay special attention to areas where metadata is typically found, such as headers, footers, title pages, or dedicated metadata sections.
For each metadata element you identify, cross-reference it with the definitions in the to ensure accurate categorization.
Extract all relevant metadata according to the structure defined in the XML tags for metadata elements.

If you encounter metadata that doesn't clearly fit into the predefined categories, use your best judgment to categorize it under the most appropriate existing element or under "Generic Metadata" if necessary.
Take a deep breath and organize your extracted metadata according to the format specified in the XML tags, ensuring you're using the correct structure for each metadata element.
Double-check that you've included all metadata present on the page, paying particular attention to easily overlooked elements like document identifiers (DOI, ISBN, etc.) or copyright information.
Review your extracted metadata to ensure it accurately represents the information present on the page, without adding or inferring information not explicitly stated.
Take a final deep breath and consider all the information you've been provided. Ensure you are accurate, following all rules, and have not omitted any crucial metadata from the page.
